firstquestion.title: How would you describe the type of product are you planning to make? For example, is the product a substance, a formulated chemical product, a material, or an article? Is it a homogenous or heterogenous material? What is the product?
firstquestion.description: For a complicated product with many components, it may be valuable to complete PrISM for each component as opposed to only for the whole product.

thirdquestion.title: What is the service provided by the product?

fourthquestion.title: What other products are used to provide this service?

wallotext.title: What sustainability attributes are you prioritizing to include in the design?
wallotext.description: Consider the product overall and at each life cycle stage. We'll guide you through some examples first and then allow you to set your priorities.

question.title: What is the preferred feedstock goal or goals? Please select all that apply.
Do you have goals to reduce life cycle impacts such as water consumption, waste generation or energy usage in production or manufacturing?
question.description: Are you planning to avoid the use of certain chemicals such as those on Manufacturing Restricted Substances Lists (MRSLs)? Please select all that apply.
enum: Reduce GHG emissions / carbon neutral / carbon negative.
Reduce/eliminate other life cycle impacts (fill in the blank).
reduce/eliminate process chemicals on Restricted Substances Lists (RSLs).
reduce other hazard process chemicals (fill in the blank).

question.title: Are you designing the product to contain only ingredients that are recognized as inherently safer such as those on the EPA Safer Chemical Ingredient List (SCIL)? Or are you avoiding chemicals of concern such as those identified on sector-based Restricted Substances Lists (RSLs).
enum: Use only safer chemicals (e.g. US EPA Safer Chemical Ingredient List (SCIL)
